intro: Xylopia batesii, commonly known as African star anise, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces berries that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their distinctive flavor. Xylopia batesii is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
